Dear Ms. Calcaterra:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
06/01/2022. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MSEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for
the following:
There are no licensing violations
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MSEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MSEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MSEP requirements except for the
following:
There are no ISEP violations.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not
be included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
SHFC 2.10.d.3.e. Staff Training Requirements-Trauma Focused Training
page 16
e) All program staff shall be provided with annual trauma-
focused program training to maintain a trauma-informed milieu
and treatment environment. Trauma-focused programming must
be based on an evidence-based treatment model.
Three out of three staff records reviewed contained overdue annual trauma-focused
training.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
4

period.
There were no citations with the interim inspection dated 06/02/2021.
SIR#2022C0219029 initiated on 03/22/2022 cited the facility for staff to resident ratio
regarding variable interval checks of residents every 15-minutes. The corrective
action plan appears to have been successful as no repeat citations are noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
